An **elven shield** is a type of [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood"), and appears as a **blue and green shield** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Player [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of the elven shield - a commented-out line of code would give an elven character in any role that starts the game with a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") an elven shield instead, which would only apply for elven [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Live [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") have an effective 5⁄12 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an elven shield.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

When worn, an elven shield grants 2 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"). Like all [elven armor](/wiki/Elven_armor "Elven armor"), an elven shield can be safely enchanted from +5, whereas most other armor may be destroyed if enchanted while above +3.

## Strategy

The elven shield is the lightest 2 AC-shield available at 40 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"), making it one of the most preferable for early characters (minus [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") that still have their starting shield) - it is the second-best shield in this regard after the much rarer [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), though it is subsceptible to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") via burning or rotting. For long-term shield users that have reflection covered via other means such as [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail") or an [amulet](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection"), the elven shield is the best option available since it can be safely enchanted from +5.

## History

The elven shield first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants may give elves (including the player) an AC bonus for wearing an elven shield.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") an elven shield will produce either an [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield") or an [Uruk-hai shield](/wiki/Uruk-hai_shield "Uruk-hai shield"), with an equal chance of each item; upgrading an orcish shield or Uruk-hai shield will produce an elven shield.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), elven shields grant +1 AC to elven monsters that wear them, including [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") players.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), an elven shield grants 2 AC, 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")2 when worn, and its weight is reduced to 30 aum.

[The Shield of Yggdrasil](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Shield_of_Yggdrasil "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") elven shield that favors elves. It grants [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") while worn, and can be safely enchanted to +7. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The Shield of Yggdrasil heals you in a similar manner to [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), elven shields grant +1 AC to elven monsters that wear them, including elven players. Elven [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start the game with an elven shield; [hobbits](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)") are an additional race that start the game with knowledge of their appearance. Elven [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") can generate with elven shields.

An elven shield can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a small shield and an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger"); [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") can be combined with an elven shield to create [elven chain mail](/wiki/Elven_chain_mail "Elven chain mail").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), elven [Paladins](/wiki/Paladin_\(role\) "Paladin (role)"), Priests and [Warriors](/wiki/Warrior_\(role\) "Warrior (role)") start the game with an elven shield in place of the role's standard small shield. [Pookas](/wiki/Pooka "Pooka") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an elven shield.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), elven shields grant +1 AC to elven monsters that wear them, including elven players.

Upgrading a small shield will produce an elven shield, and vice versa. Elven Knights start with a small shield instead of an elven shield, which they can upgrade to easily - all other details from EvilHack are applicable.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 210](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L210): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 232](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L232): *1⁄12 chance for first case, 1⁄6 chance each for second and third cases*
